metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: CSS comments are not displayed in the browser, but they can help document your source code.
content.html: CSS comments are not displayed in the browser, but they can help document your source code.

content.text: Comments are used to explain the code, and may help when you edit the source code at a later date.
content.html: Comments are used to explain the code, and may help when you edit the source code at a later date.

content.text: A CSS comment is placed inside the <style> element, and starts with /* and ends with */ :
content.html: A CSS comment is placed inside the <style> element, and starts with /* and ends with */:

content.code_html:
/* This is a single-line comment */
p {
  color: red;
}

content.text: You can add comments wherever you want in the code:
content.html: You can add comments wherever you want in the code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
color: red; 
  /* Set text color to red */

syntax_highlighting.text:
color: red; 
  /* Set text color to red */

content.code_html:
p {
  color: red;  /* Set text color to red */
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
color: red; 
  /* Set text color to red */

content.text: Even in the middle of a code line:
content.html: Even in the middle of a code line:

content.code_html:
p {
  color: /*red*/blue; 
}

content.text: Comments can also span multiple lines:

content.code_html:
/* This is
a multi-line
comment */

p {
  color: red;
}

content.text: From the HTML tutorial, you learned that you can add comments to your HTML source by using the <!--...--> syntax.
content.html: From the HTML tutorial, you learned that you can add comments to your HTML source by using the <!--...--> syntax.

content.text: In the following example, we use a combination of HTML and CSS comments:
content.html: In the following example, we use a combination of HTML and CSS comments:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
p {  color: red; /* Set 
  text color to red */}

color: red; /* Set 
  text color to red */

content.code:
My Heading

Hello World!

This paragraph is styled with CSS.

HTML and CSS comments are not shown in the output.

syntax_highlighting.text:
p {  color: red; /* Set 
  text color to red */}

color: red; /* Set 
  text color to red */

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>
p {
  color: red; /* Set text color to red */
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h2>My Heading</h2>

<!-- These paragraphs will be red -->
<p>Hello World!</p>
<p>This paragraph is styled with CSS.</p>
<p>HTML and CSS comments are not shown in the output.</p>

</body>
</html>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
p {  color: red; /* Set 
  text color to red */}

color: red; /* Set 
  text color to red */

What is the correct syntax for a CSS comment?
